change.item: Encoded in EAD by Jodi Boyle

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence, manuscript materials and lecture notes.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Inventory created in 1977 August by Sandra Hunt Hawrylchak.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: A writer, Joachim Maass (1901-1972) was born in Hamburg and came to the United States in 1938. He secured a positon at Mount Holyoke College in 1940, where he taught and lectured. He later taught German literature at Haverford College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is composed entirely of photocopied materials. The originals are in the Deutsches Literaturarchiv, Marbach, Germany. The collection includes correspondence, manuscripts of novels, short stories, plays, poetry, and essays, 1940-46; lecture notes, 1956-61; and clippings, offprints, reviews, and biographies, 1927-36.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into eight series.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives received the papers from University at Albany Professor John Spalek in January 1977. Professor Spalek received them from retired Haverford College and West Chester(Pennsylvania) State College Professor Harry Pfund and his wife Marie Pfund in January 1977. The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives photocopied the papers before the originals were sent to the Deutsches Literaturarchiv, Marbach in 1977. This was per Professor Pfund's request.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The originals of the Joachim Maass Papers are in the Deutsches Literaturarchiv (German Literature Archive), which should be contacted for permission to publish. The contact information is: Deutsche Schillergesellschaft e.V./Deutsches Literaturarchiv Marbach/ SchillerhÃ¶he 8-10/71672 Marbach am Neckar/Germany/Telephone +49 (0) 7144/ 848-0/email: info@dla-marbach.de/website: https://www.dla-marbach.de/en/meta-navigation/informationen/about-us/.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.

The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Joachim Maass Papers, 1901-1972. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Maass Papers).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains lecture notes from Haverford College. Each lecture has multiple dates, presumably relating to the dates Joachim Maass gave the lecture during different academic semesters.

did.unittitle: Haverford Lectures, First and Second Lectures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains biographical materials such as a birth certificate and award as well as clippings about Joachim Maass and his published works.

did.unittitle: Leben, Sterben und Unsterlichkeit Rainer Maria Rikes
Vorlesungen im Kurs, Problems of Red-education in Post-War Germany
